required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: UCAR-T for CD19+ Refractory/Relapsed B Hematologic Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of CTA30X UCAR-T Cell Injection in the Treatment of Patients With r/r CD19+ B Hematologic Malignancies

lead_sponsor.agency: 920th Hospital of Joint Logistics Support Force of People's Liberation Army of China

clinical_study.source: 920th Hospital of Joint Logistics Support Force of People's Liberation Army of China

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, single-center prospective study to determinethe safety and efficacy of CTA30X UCAR-T cells in patients diagnosed with CD19+ refractory/relapsed B Hematologic Malignancies

detailed_description.textblock: The main aim of the study is to determine the safety and efficacy of CTA30X UCAR-T in R/R B Hematologic Malignancies. CTA30X UCAR-T is an allogeneic chimeric antigenreceptor T-cell (CAR-T) therapy that targets CD19 and B-cell Hematologic Malignancies. The study will include 72 subjects to receive CTA30X UCAR-T singleinfusion.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after CAR-T infusion
primary_outcome.description: CRS lasting ≥7 days G3 or ≥G4 after CTA30X infusion;

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AE after CAR-T infusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after the infusion of CAR-T cells
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events after CTA30X UCAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate (ORR=CR+CRi) after CTA30X UCAR-T infusion
The overall response rate was MRD negative within 3 months after treatment
The best overall response within 3 months after treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the onset of a tumor from the first assessment of CR or PR up to 1 year

other_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 months after CAR-T infusion
other_outcome.description: The proliferation and survival time of CAR T cells in vivo and the clearance rate of B cells.

arm_group.description: CD19+ R/R B Hematologic Malignancies patients be treated with a single dose of CTA30X UCAR-T cells. Total dose of(5-30)*10E6/kg cells will be administered at Day 0

intervention.description: CTA30X UCAR-T injection is an allogeneic CAR-Ttargeted CD19 . A single infusion of CART cells will be administered intravenously.
